Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_57384
DisplayedItem.title: This checklist applies principally to soft tissue sarcomas in teenagers and adults. In general, pediatric sarcomas are treated under strict protocols that may differ significantly from the recommendations for adult type sarcomas.

ListItem.name: LI_38564
ListItem.title: Head and neck (specify site, if known)

ListItem.name: LI_42892
ListItem.title: Trunk and extremities (specify site, if known)

ListItem.name: LI_57127
ListItem.title: Abdominal visceral organs (specify site, if known)

ListItem.name: LI_46948
ListItem.title: Thoracic visceral organs (specify site, if known)

Question.name: Q_347258
Question.title: Histologic Type (World Health Organization [WHO] Classification of Soft Tissue Tumors) (Note D)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_347471
DisplayedItem.title: # The list is derived from the 2020 World Health Organization (WHO) classification of soft tissue tumors, edited to include ONLY soft tissue tumors of intermediate (locally aggressive and rarely metastasizing) potential and malignant soft tissue tumors for which anatomical staging using the AJCC system is considered to be clinically relevant.

Question.name: Q_380015
Question.title: Percentage of Hypercellular Areas (formerly known as round cells)

ListItem.name: LI_347274
ListItem.title: Congenital spindle cell rhabdomyosarcoma with VGLL2/NCOA2/CITED2 rearrangements

ListItem.name: LI_347276
ListItem.title: Intraosseous spindle cell rhabdomyosarcoma (with TFCP2/NCOA2 rearrangements)

ListItem.name: LI_21309
ListItem.title: Epithelioid malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor

ListItem.name: LI_347287
ListItem.title: Epithelioid sarcoma, proximal or large cell type

ListItem.name: LI_21330
ListItem.title: Clear cell sarcoma of soft tissue

ListItem.name: LI_347288
ListItem.title: Round cell sarcoma with EWSR1-non ETS fusions

Question.name: Q_17140
Question.title: Histologic Grade (French Federation of Cancer Centers Sarcoma Group [FNCLCC]) (Note E)

ListItem.name: LI_366679
ListItem.title: Specify mitotic rate per 10 high-power fields (HPF)

Question.name: Q_374414
Question.title: Percentage of Viable Tumor (compared with pretreatment biopsy, if available)

Question.name: Q_367509
Question.title: Distance from Tumor to Closest Margin

Question.name: Q_367519
Question.title: Other Close Margin(s) to Tumor (less than 2 cm)

ListItem.name: LI_11245
ListItem.title: Not applicable (no regional lymph nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_352503
ListItem.title: All regional lymph nodes negative for tumor

ListItem.name: LI_352504
ListItem.title: Tumor present in regional lymph node(s)

Question.name: Q_53345
Question.title: Number of Lymph Nodes with Tumor

Section.name: S_6805
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note J)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_40207
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_40207_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

ListItem.name: LI_53274
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable (histologic type not appropriate for staging)#

Property.name: p_rptTxt_53274_1
Property.val: Not applicable (histologic type not appropriate for staging)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_41512
DisplayedItem.title: # Regardless of the anatomic site, certain specific types of locally aggressive soft tissue neoplasms, which may recur locally but have either no risk of metastatic disease or an extremely low risk of metastasis, are excluded from the AJCC soft tissue sarcoma staging system. (Note J)

ListItem.name: LI_327658
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_50013
ListItem.title: pT1: Tumor less than or equal to 2 cm

ListItem.name: LI_42210
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor greater than 2 cm to less than or equal to 4 cm

DisplayedItem.name: DI_49522
DisplayedItem.title: pT4: Tumor with invasion of adjoining structures

ListItem.name: LI_40172
ListItem.title: pT4a: Tumor with orbital invasion, skull base / dural invasion, invasion of central compartment viscera, involvement of facial skeleton, or invasion of pterygoid muscles

ListItem.name: LI_42814
ListItem.title: pT4b: Tumor with brain parenchymal invasion, carotid artery encasement, prevertebral muscle invasion, or central nervous system involvement via perineural spread

ListItem.name: LI_327660
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_6808
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

ListItem.name: LI_49306
ListItem.title: pT1: Tumor 5 cm or less in greatest dimension

ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor more than 5 cm and less than or equal to 10 cm in greatest dimension

ListItem.title: pT3: Tumor more than 10 cm and less than or equal to 15 cm in greatest dimension

ListItem.title: pT4: Tumor more than 15 cm in greatest dimension

ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_46555
ListItem.title: pT1: Tumor 5 cm or less in greatest dimension

ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor more than 5 cm and less than or equal to 10 cm in greatest dimension

ListItem.title: pT1: Tumor less than or equal to 2 cm in greatest dimension
